  • Mathematical functions (mygrad.math)
  • View page source

Mathematical functions (mygrad.math)¶

Trigonometric functions¶

sin(a[, constant]) f(a) -> sin(a)
cos(a[, constant]) f(a) -> cos(a)
tan(a[, constant]) f(a) -> tan(a)
arcsin(a) f(a) -> arctanh(a)
arccos(a[, constant]) f(a) -> arccos(a)
arctan(a) f(a) -> arctan(a)
arctan2(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> arctan(a/b)

Hyperbolic functions¶

sinh(a[, constant]) f(a) -> sinh(a)
cosh(a[, constant]) f(a) -> cosh(a)
tanh(x[, constant]) f(x) -> tanh(x)
arcsinh(a[, constant]) f(a) -> arcsinh(a)
arccosh(a[, constant]) f(a) -> arccosh(a)
arctanh(a[, constant]) f(a) -> arctanh(a)

Sums, products, differences¶

prod(a[, axis, keepdims, constant]) Return the product of array elements over given axes.
sum(x[, axis, keepdims, constant]) Sum of tensor elements over a given axis.
cumprod(a[, axis, constant]) Return the cumulative product of elements along a given axis.
cumsum(a[, axis, constant]) Return the cumulative sum of the elements along a given axis.

Exponents and logarithms¶

exp(a[, constant]) f(a) -> exp(a)
expm1(a[, constant]) f(a) -> exp(a) - 1
exp2(a[, constant]) f(a) -> 2^a
log(a[, constant]) f(a) -> log(a)
log10(a[, constant]) f(a) -> log(a)
log2(a[, constant]) f(a) -> log(a)
log1p(a) The inverse of expm1.
logaddexp(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> log(exp(a) + exp(b))
logaddexp2(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> log_2(2 ** a + 2 ** b)

Other special functions¶

sinc(a[, constant]) f(a) -> sin(a) / a

Arithmetic operations¶

add(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> a + b
reciprocal(a[, constant]) f(a) -> 1 / a
positive(a[, where, constant]) f(a) -> +a
negative(a[, where, constant]) f(a) -> -a
multiply(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> a * b
divide(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> a / b
power(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> a ** b
subtract(a, b[, constant]) f(a, b) -> a - b

Miscellaneous¶

square(a[, constant]) f(a) -> a ** 2
sqrt(a[, constant]) f(a) -> sqrt(a)
cbrt(a[, constant]) f(a) -> cbrt(a)
absolute(a[, constant]) f(a) -> abs(a)
maximum(a, b[, constant]) Element-wise maximum of array elements.
minimum(a, b[, constant]) Element-wise minimum of array elements.
